*div1 type="summary"* *p*Introducing John Mathews.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Fredericktown*/location_mentioned* [Missouri], *date_mentioned n="12-06-1825">Dec. 6th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear Sir,*/p* *p*My friend *person_mentioned*John Mathews*/person_mentioned*, who will give you this letter, has been an *person_mentioned*inhabitant of this *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* for 26 years; I have been acquainted with him for 18 years and with much pleasure can recommend him as a man of integrity and a good citizen. He goes to your *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* with a view of becoming a citizen thereof. He possesses a knowledge in *person_mentioned*mineralogy*/person_mentioned*, and wishes to engage in that line. I write this note in haste as *person_mentioned*Mr. Mathews*/person_mentioned* is on the eve of Departure, would be glad to give you a full letter—but can only say, being lately at the *location_mentioned*Mines of Burton*/location_mentioned* your *person_mentioned*sister*/person_mentioned* was well—My *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*are all well. You will soon make up your acquaintance with *person_mentioned*Mr Mathews*/person_mentioned*, who will give you all the local news,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John McArther*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
